definition[0]: to write your name in a book when you leave a place such as a hotel, an office, or a club
definition[1]: to write your name on a form or in a book to show that you have taken or borrowed something
example[0]: Bernstein signed out a company car.
definition[2]: to write in a book that someone is allowed to leave somewhere such as a school, an office etc
example[1]: Parents must sign pupils out when collecting them for doctor’s or dentist’s appointments.
